question:
With reference to the release of the School Education Quality Index, consider the following statements about the states’ and UTs’ performance :
  1. Kerala was ranked at the top of the index.
  2. Uttar Pradesh was ranked at the bottom of the index.
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: Statement 1 is correct: The index is an initiative of the NITI Aayog. The study found that Kerala was the top performer in the country. The state had shown the highest percentage of increase in performance from 77.6% in 2015-16 to 82.2% in 2016-17. The other top performers were Rajasthan and Karnataka. Statement 2 is correct: Uttar Pradesh was ranked at the bottom by the index. This is the most populous state in the country. A reduction in performance was seen in Karnataka, Uttarakhand, Arunachal Pradesh, Sikkim and Mizoram. All the union territories had recorded an improvement in performance.
